title: Sunday Ikpe
text:
Hey there! I started my journey as a physician but switched gears to dive headfirst into the exciting world of tech. Along the way, I’ve explored everything from health informatics to computational epidemiology and data science. With nearly two decades of experience under my belt, I’ve become quite the coding ninja. I’ve tinkered with Python for over a decade, danced with SQL for more than 15 years, and dabbled in R for 7. Linux? Been there, done that for 15+ years. I’m also fluent in containerization (think Docker and LXC), JavaScript, and PHP. Oh, and let’s not forget my love affair with machine learning and big data! Leading teams is my jam—I’ve rallied groups of up to 20 pros to tackle some seriously cool projects. Right now, I’m rocking it as a Senior Research Analyst, always hungry for the next data-driven adventure. Let’s connect and make some magic together!
I am a husband, love music and play a little of the keyboards and bass guitar. I do some chess, but am definitely not a master. A huge Liverpool football club fan (YNWA!).

title: Sunday Ikpe
text:
Tools/Skills
Python | PHP | R | SAS | SQL | HTML | JavaScript | CSS | Biostatistics | Epidemiology | Bioinformatics | Machine Learning | Natural Language Processing | Time Series Analysis | Geospatial Analysis | Docker | LXC | Linux | GGPlot | Tableau | Shiny | PySpark
:::

title: Learning
text: I teach datascience with python and R. While you do not need to know much to get into the trainig it may help to know enough math to carry out basic operations such as as addition, subtraction, multiplication and division (arithmetic), and what it means to say \(x = 3\) or \(y = 4.5\) (algebra). Having some excel skill can be helpful too but is not required.

title: Learning
text:
Curriculum

Introduction

Introduction to the requirements
Tools
Why statistics
Why visualization



Statistics

Types of variables
Data exploration
Single variable analysis (Univariate analysis)
Comparing two variables (Bivariate analysis)
Basics of visualizing data
Hypothesis testing

Null hypothesis/Alternative hypothesis
Type 1 and type 2 error




Python or R

Data wrangling
Data primitives
Operators
Control Structure
Functions

These are expanded on below


Data wrangling with SQL

Basics of querying relational databases
Selecting all data
Selecting specific variables (columns)
Aliasing variable (column) names
Filtering with the WHERE clause
Arranging or sorting data with the ORDER BY clause

Reversing the sorting with the DESC clause

Restricting amount of data retrieved with the LIMIT clause (or TOP)
Deeper dive into filtering

Understanging logic with AND and OR
Using parenthesis (...)
Filtering from a set with IN
Partial match with LIKE and the wildcard %

Creating new variables (Columns)

With fixed values
With derrived values

Case statements with CASE
Functions and the DISTINCT clause
Understanding combining datasets

Vertical combinations with UNION and UNION ALL
Horizontal combinations with joins - OUTER JOIN, INNER JOIN, LEFT JOIN, RIGHT JOIN and the ON statement

Aggregated data

The GROUP BY clause
The HAVING filter for aggregated data

Window functions

Understanding the OVER, PARTITION BY syntax
Value window functions - FIRST_VALUE, LAST_VALUE, LEAD, LAG
Ranking window functions - ROW_NUMBER, RANK, DENSE_RANK, NTILE, PERCENT_RANK, CUME_DIST
Aggregate window functions - MIN, MAX, COUNT, SUM, AVG




Data vizualization

GGPlot2

The basic construct - ggplot() + aes() + geom_*()

Tableau

Importing data and joining
Creating worksheets with visualization
Creating analytical variables
Creating dashboards
Creating stories

Shiny R
Shiny for Python

title: Learning
text:
Python

Introduction and data types

Integers, floats, strings, booleans
Collections - tuples, lists, dictionaries



Operators

The assignment operator =
Mathematical operators +, -, *, /, %, **
Comparison operators ==, >, <, >=, <=, !, !=, in, not in, is, is not
Logical operators and, or
The OOP (dot) operator .



Control Strucutre - Logic

Undestanging if, if-else, if-elif-else constructs
Ternary if statement



Control Structure - Loops

While loops
For loops
Comprehensions [item for item in items]

Mapping
Filtering




Functions

Inbuilt functions
User defined functions
Understanding arguments fn(*a, **kw)
Understanding return



Strings

The f-string
Strings as objects
What are methods
String methods
Chaining methods



Collections

Zero indexed collections - tuples, lists
Key value pairs
Indexing collections (and reverse indexing)
Slicing collections
Methods



Object oriented programming

Classes
Objects
The constructor with the dunder init __init__()
Understanding the soul of the object - self
Attributes
Methods
Inheritance
Polymorphism
Encapsulation
Dunder methods __repr__()
Decorators - @property, @prop.setter



Modules

SQLAlchemy
Requests
Numpy
Pandas
SciPy
Statsmodels

title: Learning
text:
R-Programming

Data types

Primitives

Scalers - numeric, character, logical
Vectors
Matrices
Lists
DataFrames
Indexing
Slicing




Operators

Assignment operators =, <-, ->

Naming variables - numeric, character, dot, underscore

Mathematical operators +, -, *, /, %%, ^
Comparison operators ==, >, <, >=, <=, %in%, !
Logical operators &, |
Operator precedence



Control Structure - Logic

If, if-else, if-else if-else
ternary ifelse(Logical, truth, alternative) function



Control Structure - Loops

While loops
For loops



Functions

In built functions
User defined functions
Using the function to create functions



Dataframes

Extracting variables as vectors

Syntax with df$vector
Using the with(df, vector) function




Packages

What are packages
Installing packages with install.packages('package')
Enabling packages - library(pakage), or require(package)



Tidyverse

The pipe operators %>% or |>
Selecting variables
Renaming variables
Filtering
Creating new variables
Ordering
Limiting returned values
Aggregating
Joining dataframes
Converting data from long to wide and vice versa
Window functions



AB Testing

Exploring data
Regression analysis

Linear regression
Logistic regression




Gtsummary

Producing tables for univariate summaries tbl_summary()
Producing tabels for bivariate analysis tbl_summary(by=...)
Adding p-values add_p()
Producing regression tables tbl_regression(exponentiate=F)
Tweaking

Statistical analysis
Variable types
Missingness

Combining tables with tbl_stack(list(tbl1, tbl2), c('name1', 'name2')) or tbl_merge(list(tbl1, tbl2), c('name1', 'name2'))
